t: Job 36
Elihu Extols God’s Greatness
And*p Elihu continued, and said:
“Bear*pn with me a little, and I will show you, for*ld I have yet something to say on God’s behalf.
I*ln will get my knowledge from afar and*ld ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
For*ln truly my words are not false; one*ld who is perfect in knowledge is with you.
“Behold,*pn God is mighty, and does not despise any; he*ld is mighty in strength of understanding.
He*ln does not keep the wicked alive, but*ld gives the afflicted their right.
He*ln does not withdraw his eyes from the righteous, but*ld with kings on the throne he*ld sets them forever, and they are exalted.
And*ln if they are bound in chains and*ld caught in the cords of affliction,
then*ln he declares to them their work and*ld their transgressions, that they are behaving arrogantly.
He*ln opens their ears to instruction and*ld commands that they return from iniquity.
If*ln they listen and serve him, they*ld complete their days in prosperity, and*ld their years in pleasantness.
But*ln if they do not listen, they perish by the sword and*ld die without knowledge.
“The*pn godless in heart cherish anger; they*ld do not cry for help when he binds them.
They*ln die in youth, and*ld their life ends among the cult prostitutes.
He*ln delivers the afflicted by their affliction and*ld opens their ear by adversity.
He*ln also allured you out of distress into*ld a broad place where there was no cramping, and*ld what was set on your table was full of fatness.
“But*pn you are full of the judgment on the wicked; judgment*ld and justice seize you.
Beware*ln lest wrath entice you into scoffing, and*ld let not the greatness of the ransom turn you aside.
Will*ln your cry for help avail to keep you from distress, or*ld all the force of your strength?
Do*ln not long for the night, when*ld peoples vanish in their place.
Take*ln care; do not turn to iniquity, for*ld this you have chosen rather than affliction.
Behold,*ln God is exalted in his power; who*ld is a teacher like him?
Who*ln has prescribed for him his way, or*ld who can say, ‘You have done wrong’?
“Remember*pn to extol his work, of*ld which men have sung.
All*ln mankind has looked on it; man*ld beholds it from afar.
Behold,*ln God is great, and we know him not; the*ld number of his years is unsearchable.
For*ln he draws up the drops of water; they*ld distill his mist in rain,
which*ln the skies pour down and*ld drop on mankind abundantly.
Can*ln anyone understand the spreading of the clouds, the*ld thunderings of his pavilion?
Behold,*ln he scatters his lightning about him and*ld covers the roots of the sea.
For*ln by these he judges peoples; he*ld gives food in abundance.
He*ln covers his hands with the lightning and*ld commands it to strike the mark.
Its*ln crashing declares his presence; the*ld cattle also declare that he rises.
